titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Carl Landauer papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Sally DeBauche

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-12-02T14:08-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

physdesc.extent: 43 manuscript boxes, 1 card file box, 1 oversize box

did.abstract: Correspondence, printed matter, and sound recordings of interviews relating to economics, world politics, and efforts to aid German Jewish refugees to the United States during the 1930s and World War II.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copies of some sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access. To access other sound recordings, video recordings, or motion picture material, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Carl Landauer papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1990.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Received PhD in Economics from Ruprecht-Karls-Universität Heidelberg (Heidelberg University)

eventgrp.event: Served as a research assistant at the Institut für Seeverkehr und Weltwirtschaft (Institute for Marine Commerce and International Economics)

chronitem.event: Served as an administrative assistant for the German War Food Administration
Served as a teaching assistant at Handelshochschule (College of Commerce)
Appointed as lecturer at the University of California, Berkeley
Appointed as professor at the University of California, Berkeley
Published Theory of National Economic Planning
Appointed as guest professor at Freie Universität Berlin (Free University of Berlin)

eventgrp.event: Retired from position at the University of California, Berkeley

chronitem.event: Awarded Fulbright Scholarship to lecture in Frankfurt and Hamburg
Recieved an honorary degree from the University of California, Berkeley
Received an honorary degree from the Universität Hamburg (University of Hamburg)
Received the Award for Cultural Achievement from the German Labor Federation
Posthumously published Corporate State Ideologies : Historical Roots and Philosophical Origins

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Carl Landauer papers consist of correspondence, writings, and sound recordings of interviews related to economics, world politics, and Landauer’s efforts to aid German Jewish refugees during the 1930s and World War II. The collection is organized into eight series: Biographical File, Writings, Correspondence, Collected Correspondence, Writings by Others, Photographs, Printed Matter, and Sound Recordings.

Correspondence makes up the bulk of the collection and reflects Landauer’s professional and personal relationships with colleagues, friends, and family members. This section is arranged into two sub sections: Professional Correspondence and Personal Correspondence, a distinction maintained from Landauer’s own arrangement of his papers. The correspondence is further arranged in alphabetical order. Landauer’s professional correspondence documents his career as a Professor of Economics at the University of California, Berkeley and his collaboration with other contemporary American economists. Also of note is correspondence with various Jewish philanthropic organizations and government agencies related to Landauer’s efforts to aid German Jewish refugees seeking to immigrate to the United States and escape persecution in Germany during World War II.

The Landauer papers also contain extensive documentation of Landauer’s family history, childhood, and early career in the form of autobiographical writings, curriculum vitae, sound recordings of oral histories, and correspondence. Of particular interest are collections of correspondence sent from the Eastern front during World War I by Landauer’s brother, Fritz Landauer, and his brother-in-law, Arthur Stein.

did.unittitle: Budget for production of Mrs. Uptown Carrie,
"Atomische Konkurrenz oder organisierte Wirtschaft? Ein Dilemma amerikanischer Wirtschaftpolitik seit den Tagen Theodore Roosevelts,"
"The Bavarian Problem in the Weimar Republic, 1918-1923 Part I,"
"Bemerkungen zum einem alten Problem : Revolution - Reform,"
"A Break in Keynes's Theory of Interest,"
"Grundprobleme der funktionellen Verteilung des Wirtschaftswertes," with related correspondence,
Memorandum on Jewish refugees with related correspondence,
"Socialism in Relation to War and Peace,"
"Die Theorien der Merkantalisten und Physiokraten über die ökonomische Bedeutung des Luxus,"
"Die Weltwirtschaftspolitik der Vereinigten Staaten von Amerika,"
"Will Germany Be Ruled by Her Army?,"
Association for a Democratic Austrian Republic,
The Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced German Scholars,
Emergency Committee to Save the Jewish People of Europe,
Federation of Jewish Charities of San Francisco,
German Labor Delegation in the United States,
Interessengemeinschaft der durch NS-Regime geschädigten Wissenschaftlicher,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence related to Carl Landauer's interest in the legal situation of Paul T. Borchardt, a German citizen accused of espionage by the United States government.

did.unittitle: Phi Beta Kappa Society, University of California, Berkeley,
San Francisco Committee for Service to Emigres,
United States Department of the Army,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence related to Landauer's service on the Academic Senate and the Loyalty Oath controversy of 1949-1951.

Interviews of Carl Landauer by Ida Landauer,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Compact sound cassettes
The descriptions of these interviews have been taken directly from Ida Landauer's labels. References to "Vati" likely refer to Carl Landauer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Heine's poems, Vati's childhood, leaving Germany, coming to Berkeley. Tape interview gives the date as 5 June 1982, but Ida Landauer gives the date as 23 May 1982.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A discussion of German officers and systems. Touches on his activism and interest in journalism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: War Food Admininstration, newspapers, the mayor of Munich, Franz Feuchtwanger, family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Focuses on his parents and Nazi Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
